They quartered the troops in an old factory building. This cantonment town quartered the British soldiers at the time of British Empire. I have quartered the troops constantly in houses, so that they have suffered very little. The soldiers quartered in the court- house, later the old city hall, and in the school-houses.

sense.name: divide into quarters
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent[animate]] QUARTER NP2[patient[concrete]] (PP[instrument]) NP1[theme|instrument] QUARTER NP2[patient]
sense.examples: Balder rapidly quartered the apple with a dagger. The shield depicts a yellow lion above a white field quartered by the cross of Saint George. Small fruits should be quartered by the method used for particulate foods. The traditional Celtic year was quartered by the solstices and the equinoxes. An untanned, pickled calfskin was quartered by cutting down the backbone and across the waist. The resulting pulps were quartered by rotary splitter.
